Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a red/brown self-slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.174)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36392) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36392)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 249 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13438 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
